metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15049 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in http/ContentLengthInterpreter.cc in Squid before 4.12 and 5.x before 5.0.3. A Request Smuggling and Poisoning attack can succeed against the HTTP cache. The client sends an HTTP request with a Content-Length header containing "+\ "-" or an uncommon shell whitespace character prefix to the length field-value.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 4.10-1ubuntu1.3
squid-cgi - 4.10-1ubuntu1.3
squid-common - 4.10-1ubuntu1.3
squid-purge - 4.10-1ubuntu1.3
squidclient - 4.10-1ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream, "This attack requires an upstream server to participate in the smuggling and generate the poison response sequence."

criterions.comment: squid package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10-1ubuntu1.3').
